p: How bacterial SAgs manipulate IAV infection- and vaccination-elicited T CD8 responses is poorly understood. Exposure to SAgs can create physical and/or functional holes in mouse T cell repertoires by eliminating or anergizing many T cells [ 16â€“ 18]. This is assumed to put a fraction of T CD8 with antiviral specificities out of commission, at least temporarily. Paradoxically, we demonstrated that SAgs activate and expand preexisting IAV-specific memory T CD8 in mice and humans [ 19], and not the opposite as conventionally predicted.
